arts.ttl: Incredible moment Liverpool goalkeeper Caoimhin Kelleher saves a penalty save AND stops rebound during Ireland's win over Finland
arts.sum: The Irish stopper saved a late penalty from Joel Pohjanpalo before scrambling across goal to smother the follow-up from Robin Lod to keep his side 1-0 up.

arts.ttl: 'I went with my instincts' - Kelleher on penalty save
arts.sum: Republic of Ireland goalkeeper Caoimhin Kelleher says there are "lots of positives" after the Republic of Ireland defeat Finland in their final home Nations League game.

arts.ttl: 'He could be one of world's best' - what now for Kelleher?
arts.sum: Alisson Becker's imminent return from injury means Caoimhin Kelleher's latest run in the Liverpool team might be over - so what next for a goalkeeper who 'could be one of the world's best'?

arts.ttl: Nations League: Ferguson heads Ireland winner as Tonali strike rocks Belgium
arts.sum: Brighton striker and Kelleher penalty save see off Finland Newcastle’s Tonali hits first Italy goal for 1-0 victory Evan Ferguson’s fourth senior international goal handed Republic of Ireland a 1-0 Nations League victory over Finland as Caoimhín Kelleher saved a penalty to see them across the line. The 20-year-old Brighton striker’s header in the final minute of the first half proved sufficient to add three more points in Group B2 to those his side secured in the reverse fixture in Helsinki last month, but only after Liverpool keeper Kelleher had kept out the substitute Joel Pohjanpalo’s second-half spot-kick. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Heimir Hallgrimsson says Ireland must improve to qualify for 2026 World Cup
arts.sum: Ireland head for Wembley on Sunday for their final League B2 fixture.

arts.ttl: Evan Ferguson and Caoimhin Kelleher give Ireland glimpse of the future in Finland win
arts.sum: Ireland 1-0 Finland: Ferguson grabbed the winner and goalkeeper Kelleher saved Joel Pohjanpalo’s penalty in a hard-fought victory

arts.ttl: Kelleher saves the day as Ireland ride luck to win
arts.sum: Finland enjoyed the best moment as they moved the ball up the right, with Robin Lod and Nikolai Alho combining well to set up Kaan Kairinen in space inside the penalty area, however, his poor shot was helped wide for a corner. But Finland took over shortly after and had two great chances inside three minutes when Mikey Johnston was caught in possession, allowing Lod to race inside the box and curl a beautiful effort beyond Kelleher, however, the post saved Ireland, and Johnston’s blushes.

arts.ttl: Evan Ferguson strike gives Ireland victory over Finland
arts.sum: Keeper Kelleher kept out Joel Pohjanpalo’s penalty to preserve Ireland’s lead.

arts.ttl: Could a Finnish double give Ireland some hope?
arts.sum: In the interim period Irish sides have failed to beat some of the giants of the European game twice in the same group, including Azerbaijan, Armenia, Georgia, Luxembourg, and one of our nearest neighbours, Scotland. You have to go back to October 2017 for the last time the Boys in Green managed to beat anyone other than Gibraltar twice in the same group.

arts.ttl: Reason Thomas Tuchel isn't managing England yet as he misses Greece and Ireland matches
arts.sum: England fans will have to wait until next year to see Thomas Tuchel take charge of the team, with Lee Carsley overseeing the Nations League games against Greece and Ireland
